app.title: Wine Shelf Scanner
app.description: Never guess at the wine shelf again. Ratings from 21 million reviews, on every bottle, instantly.

camera.heroTitle: Never guess at the wine shelf again.
camera.heroSubtitle: Ratings from 21 million reviews — on every bottle, instantly.
camera.dragDrop: Drag and drop an image here

processing.aiIdentifying: Our AI is identifying bottles and fetching ratings. This may take a few seconds.
processing.tip1: Tap any rating badge to see details
processing.tip2: Top-rated bottles get a gold highlight
processing.tip5: Swipe down on wine details to dismiss
processing.tip6: The best bottle isn't always the most expensive
processing.tip7: "Wine is sunlight, held together by water." — Galileo
processing.tip8: We aggregate ratings so you don't have to

results.bottlesFound: {count, plural, one {# bottle found} other {# bottles found}}

fallback.tryDifferentAngle: Try a closer photo or a different angle

about.title: Wine Shelf Scanner
about.description: Ratings aggregated from 21 million reviews across community wine platforms. Individual scores are combined to provide a single trusted rating for each bottle.
about.disclaimer: Ratings sourced from community wine platforms. Wine Shelf Scanner is not affiliated with any rating provider.

bugReport.notExpected: Not what you expected? Report an issue

warmup.title: Waking up the sommelier
warmup.message: Our server sleeps between pours to keep costs down. Give it a moment to decant.
warmup.tip1: The world's oldest bottle of wine is over 1,650 years old
warmup.tip2: There are more than 10,000 grape varieties used for wine worldwide
warmup.tip3: A single barrel of wine equals about 300 bottles
warmup.tip4: The fear of wine is called oenophobia. We have the opposite problem.
warmup.tip5: Champagne has about 49 million bubbles per bottle
warmup.tip6: Wine was discovered around 6,000 BC in the region now known as Georgia
warmup.tip7: The pressure in a champagne bottle is about 3x that of a car tire
warmup.tip8: Vatican City has the highest wine consumption per capita in the world
warmup.tip9: In ancient Rome, women who drank wine could be legally punished by their husbands
warmup.tip10: A 'butt' is an actual wine measurement — about 126 gallons
warmup.tip11: "Wine is bottled poetry." — Robert Louis Stevenson
warmup.tip12: "I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food." — W.C. Fields
warmup.tip13: Hippocrates used wine as a treatment for fevers around 400 BC
warmup.tip14: "Wine makes every meal an occasion, every table more elegant, every day more civilized." — André Simon
warmup.tip15: A wine's 'legs' tell you about its alcohol and sugar content, not quality
warmup.tip16: "Age is just a number. It's totally irrelevant unless, of course, you happen to be a bottle of wine." — Joan Collins
warmup.tip17: There's a high-end wine glass called the "Claus Riedel" that costs over $100 each
warmup.tip18: The longest champagne cork flight was over 177 feet
warmup.tip19: "Wine is the only artwork you can drink." — Luis Fernando Olaverri
warmup.tip20: Ancient Egyptians used wine for medicinal purposes and in religious ceremonies
warmup.tip21: The average age of a French oak tree used for wine barrels is 170 years
warmup.tip22: "In victory, you deserve Champagne; in defeat, you need it." — Napoleon Bonaparte
warmup.tip24: Red wine gets its color from grape skins, not the juice
warmup.tip25: "Beer is made by men, wine by God." — Martin Luther
warmup.tip26: A sommelier can identify hundreds of wines blindfolded
warmup.tip27: Wine is the second most traded commodity in London after oil
warmup.tip28: The most expensive bottle of wine ever sold went for $558,000
warmup.tip29: "Wine improves with age. The older I get, the better I like it." — Anonymous
warmup.tip30: Italy, France, and Spain produce nearly half the world's wine
